The claim was based on a headline from a: com article that suggested President Trump said police and firefighters make too much money.
The article itself did not provide any d: but rather focused on the controversial tax bill passed in late 2017 and its impact on taxpayers.
The article used a quote from Salon: com to support its claim, but the quote only mentioned law enforcement as one example of those affected by the new tax law, without specifically stating that they make too much money.
The expert: s verdict concluded that there was no indication from the sources provided that Trump said or implied that police, firefighters, or any first responders make too much money. The focus of the claim was on the tax deductions and not on the salaries of these professions.
